Hyundai ImageQuest F910

09 Apr 2007 I'm tired of looking at the 800x600 @ 80Hz version of my screen, just because a projector I borrowed couldn't handle a higher resolution.

Time to fix that.

My monitor is an "old" Hyundai ImageQuest F910, 19 inch.

Information:
http://www.hyundaiq.ch/support/download.htm

Horizontal frequency range: 31.5-106.3KHz
Vertical frequency range: 60-120Hz
Dotclock (bandwidth): 261MHz

Going here to create modelines:
http://xtiming.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/xtiming.pl

With 261MHz dotclock.

This is the screen section I use:


Section "Monitor"
        Identifier      "Hyundai ImageQuest F910"
        Option          "DPMS"
        HorizSync       31.5-106.3
        VertRefresh     60-120

Modeline "1600x1200@78" 261.00 1600 1632 2616 2648 1200 1223 1238 1261
Modeline "1280x1024@85" 188.40 1280 1312 2024 2056 1024 1043 1057 1076
Modeline "1024x768@100" 126.64 1024 1056 1536 1568 768 781 794 807
Modeline "800x600@85" 58.20 800 832 1048 1080 600 611 620 631
Modeline "640x480@120" 55.43 640 672 880 912 480 487 497 505

EndSection
